title: What's your social support profile?
description: A strengths-based snapshot of the types of support available to you.

traits.name: Emotional/informational support
traits.description: This is the kind of support that helps you feel understood, steadied, and mentally clearer. It includes people who listen well, offer reassurance, or help you make sense of what's happening. It’s the experience of having space to talk openly and receiving thoughtful guidance when you want it.

traits.name: Tangible support
traits.description: This support appears when everyday tasks feel heavier and practical help makes things easier. It might show up as help with chores, meals, transport, or simply easing your load during demanding moments. It’s about reducing pressure so you can focus on your wellbeing during treatment.

traits.name: Affectionate support
traits.description: This is warmth, closeness, and care expressed in ways that feel comforting to you. It can include physical affection, gentle encouragement, or gestures that make you feel valued and emotionally held. It’s the sense of being loved and supported at a deeper personal level.

traits.name: Positive social interaction
traits.description: Positive-social support is the lightness that comes from spending relaxing, enjoyable time with others. These are moments that help you unwind, laugh, or take your mind off treatment for a while. It brings ease, breathing space, and a sense of normality during a challenging journey.

questions.text: How often would you be able to find someone to help you if you were confined to bed?
How often would you be able to find someone you can count on to listen to you  when you need to talk?
How often would you be able to find someone to give you good advice about a  crisis ?
How often would you be able to find someone to take you to the doctor if you  needed it ?
How often would you be able to find someone who shows you love and  affection .?
How often would you be able to find someone to have a good time with?
How often would you be able to find someone to give you information to help  you understand a situation?
How often would you be able to find someone to confide in or talk to about  yourself or your problems?
How often would you be able to find someone who hugs you?
How often would you be able to find someone to get together with for relaxation?
How often would you be able to find someone to prepare your meals if you  were unable to do it yourself?
How often would you be able to find someone whose advice you really want?
How often would you be able to find someone to do things with to help you get your mind off things?
How often would you be able to find someone to help you with daily chores if you were sick?
How often would you be able to find someone to share your most private  worries and fears with?
How often would you be able to find someone to turn to for suggestions about  how to deal with a personal problem?
How often would you be able to find someone to do something enjoyable with?
How often would you be able to find someone who understands your problems?
How often would you be able to find someone to love and make you feel wanted?
